arm_group.description: three questionnaires to be completed by the subjects

brief_summary.textblock:
The hypothesis of this study is that there will be a variety of factors influencing the
      musculoskeletal complaints among workers of different sectors.

      Work-related musculoskeletal disorders (WMSDs) account for more than 30% of occupational
      diseases in the world. In order to organize the strategic actions that will be developed for
      the prevention of MSDs, it is essential to analyze in advance the peculiar situations of the
      different sectors of a workplace. The objectives of this study were to determine the
      prevalence of musculoskeletal complaints among workers in a medium-sized industry by
      comparing its sectors and to investigate the influence of occupational and non-occupational
      factors in the increase of complaints.

detailed_description.textblock:
The Nordic questionnaire was used to asses musculoskeletal symptoms as well as
      questionnaires about lifestyle and work-related conditions in 185 workers divided into three
      sectors of an industry (factory - microelectronics, office and logistics)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  work in the industry

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  work less than a month in the industry

intervention.description: 185 industry workers divided in three sectors (factory, office and logistics) were assessed using the Nordic Musculoskeletal Questionnaire and lifestyle and work-related conditions questionnaires.

facility.name: Faculty of Medicine. University of Sao Paulo

clinical_study.official_title: Factors That Influence the Prevalence of Musculoskeletal Complaints Among Workers in Different Sectors of an Industry
